meta.notes: Initial structured dataset. Verify every entry against official consular websites before production.

visitor.description: Temporary Resident Visa (TRV) required for many nationalities; some passport holders require an eTA instead of a visa when arriving by air.
visitor.financialRequirement: Sufficient funds to cover stay (varies by case)
visitor.notes: Some nationals (e.g., French) use eTA when arriving by air. Biometrics may be required.

student.description: Study permit required for most programs longer than 6 months.
student.financialRequirement: Proof as per IRCC (tuition + living costs)
student.notes: Some applicants may also need a TRV or eTA.

work.description: Work permit usually required (employer-specific or open permit).
documents: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) if required
work.financialRequirement: Proof you can support yourself until receiving income
work.notes: Employer obligations and LMIA rules apply for many streams.

visitor.description: French citizens are visa-exempt for short visits; eTA required when arriving by air.
visitor.processingTime: Minutes to a few days for eTA
visitor.notes: Typically visa-exempt for stays up to 6 months. eTA is not a visa.

visitor.description: TRV (Temporary Resident Visa) required for Algerian passport holders.
visitor.notes: Additional documents (police cert, biometrics) commonly required.

visitor.description: TRV required for Tunisian passport holders.
visitor.notes: Check IRCC VAC guidance for local document list.

visitor.description: TRV required for Moroccan passport holders (unless special exemptions).
visitor.notes: Local VAC procedures apply.

visitor.description: Schengen short-stay (Type C) for short trips; many nationalities need a Schengen visa for stays up to 90 days.
visitor.notes: EU/EEA citizens do not require a visa; citizens of some countries have visa-exemption.

student.description: Long-stay student visa (VLS-TS) generally required for study longer than 90 days.
student.processingTime: Several weeks (varies by consulate and nationality)
student.financialRequirement: Guideline amounts (e.g., ~â‚¬615/month), verify with Campus France
student.notes: Campus France procedure often required for certain nationalities.

work.description: Long-stay work visa required for employment in France; employer obligations apply.
work.notes: Some permits require prior approval from French authorities.

visitor.description: French citizens do not require a visa to enter France.
visitor.notes: You are a citizen of this country.

visitor.description: Schengen visa required for Algerian passport holders.
visitor.notes: Additional paperwork often requested (invitation, proof of funds).

visitor.description: Schengen visa required for Tunisian passport holders (short-stay).
visitor.notes: Verify local consulate requirements.

visitor.description: Schengen visa required for Moroccan passport holders (short-stay).
visitor.notes: Verify local consulate requirements.

visitor.description: Visitor visa required for many nationalities; some passports (e.g., EU) are visa-exempt for short stays.
visitor.cost: Varies by nationality and consulate (example ~Â¥3,000 for single-entry in some cases)
visitor.notes: Visa exemption applies to specific nationalities (e.g., many EU passports).

student.description: Student visa required with Certificate of Eligibility (CoE).
student.financialRequirement: Proof of tuition and living funds

work.description: Work visa required; Certificate of Eligibility typically needed.
work.notes: Different categories (Engineer, Skilled Labour, etc.) have specific rules.

visitor.description: French citizens are generally visa-exempt for short tourist stays (e.g., up to 90 days).
visitor.notes: Confirm entry conditions at port of entry.

visitor.description: Visitor visa required for Algerian passport holders.
visitor.notes: Local embassy/consulate may request extra documents.

visitor.description: Visitor visa generally required.
visitor.notes: Check local Japanese diplomatic mission for current rules.

visitor.description: Visitor visa generally required for Moroccan passport holders (verify exemptions).
visitor.notes: Check local consulate for up-to-date procedures.

visitor.description: Visitor/short-stay rules depend on nationality; many European passports are visa-exempt, others require visa.
visitor.notes: Check Moroccan consular guidance by nationality.

student.description: Student visa / residency permit required for studies longer than short stay.

work.description: Work visa / permit required for employment in Morocco.
work.notes: Employer must usually start administrative process locally.

visitor.description: French citizens often enjoy visa-free short stays (check latest bilateral rules).
visitor.notes: No visa for many short stays, verify for passport type.

visitor.description: Visa rules depend on diplomatic agreements; check consulate.
visitor.notes: Confirm with Moroccan diplomatic mission.

visitor.description: Check consular guidance for Tunisian passport holders.
Citizens of Morocco do not require visa to visit Morocco.
visitor.notes: You are a citizen of this country.

visitor.description: Visitor rules vary; many nationals require a visa while some are exempt.
visitor.notes: Refer to Tunisian consulate per nationality.

student.description: Student authorization/visa usually required for long-term study.

work.description: Work permit required for employment in Tunisia.

visitor.description: Some passport holders (e.g., French) may enjoy visa-exempt entry for short stays â€” verify latest rules.
Visa rules depend on bilateral agreements; verify with authorities.
Citizens of Tunisia do not require visa to enter Tunisia.
Check Tunisian consular guidance for Moroccan passport holders.
